title: Cryptomultiplier
author: Cryptomultiplier
content: I don't know if am the only one who has had problems recently when trying to complete transactions using mobile apps or USSD codes. Things weren't like this till the new monetary policies and the just concluded presidential  elections came. Am not attributing the poor network reception as the main factor for failed transactions, but it is contributory to why there is consistent failed transactions.*Could there be any other better explanation to why even online transactions and the recent online apps for swift money transfer and other transactions, OPAY, PALMPAY are experiencing same network issue, although it is not as severe as that affecting bank apps and their USSD codes?*What other apps can enable swift transactions without network delay or scammers/hackers issues?

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Due to the poor banking system and the problems experienced by Nigerians from commercial banks, with long queues of unconfirmed transactions to unavailability of the banking services from commercial banks in recent times, millions of Nigerians have now migrated to only digital wallets and other digital microfinance banks such as Opay, Kuda, palm pay and the rest of what have you. -This increase in demands from Nigerians for the digital wallet which has become the best alternative to a commercial bank, has forced many of them to experience overcrowded network congestion since everyone now relies on their networks to carry out transactions without facing any issues. -This overwhelming turnout of events due to the new monetary policy has made those digital wallet networks to become slower and highly congested, so aside from bad internet networks this also contributes largely to what causes the bad and slow transaction process experienced lately by those banks.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Poor internet service in Nigeria is not a new thing though but ever since the naira swap saga, it became obvious that the Nigerian banks  could not really maintain internet banking service as there was lots of network failure which resulted to failed transactions, delay in crediting  and other banking palava which the citizens need to hurdle through. As a result of the new digital transfer policy, people opted for internet banking service which became overcrowded and caused delay as most banking servers could not be able to contain the traffic hence the errors in transactions, failures and lots more. Banking apps experience is terrible not to talk of the USSD codes. Just yesterday i had to make payment for goods purchased upon payment, i used the banking app and just a click for transaction confirmation, i was debited twice and the receiving bank did not credit the seller till it was evening. I was fast enough to inform the seller so he could be aware before i left and when he received it, he had to return the excess. This should be a good avenue  for massive awareness and adoption of bitcoin.

comments.author: Alphakilo
comments.body: The new Naira policy we are facing is the major cause of all banks app failed transaction because the network is congested, a lot of people try to make a transfer at the same time and the banks don't have strong network system that can serve everybody at the same time. USSD is the worst of it. I have multiples of failed transactions that has not been refunded till date. It makes life so difficult because when you want to buy anything you will have to make a transfer. Presently, i think Opay is one of the best financial institution that the network is a bit better than other banks app. I have been using Opay for long now and i have not experienced a failed transactions.

comments.author: Chilwell
comments.body: It has even turned to serious prayer now any time you want to make any transactions been transfer or withdraw. It is no easy in this country we were told there is no white collar job it took us time to adapt with the conditions, now that we have all moved on to survive on our own personal hustling, they still don't want that, that is when the redesign of new naira note comes in, the banks then started having issues saying it is network problem. Then we decided to live their banks for them to join wallet account like Opay, PalmPay and many more, now they have started disturbing our wallet account again. The issues have never experienced in my Opay wallet account is what am facing now. I perform one transaction three days ago I was debited and the receiver place it was still showing pending and it even Opay to Opay. Now you will make a transaction it will be successful but you will not see the transaction in the transaction history. Truly this is getting out of hand.

comments.author: Obari
comments.body: Quote from: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange on March 08, 2023, 09:45:46 PMWell, that's not a new issue with Nigerian banks; This very period I think the issues are new because if you could agree with me, you'll understand that the network has been so down beyond normal even with virtual banks which wasn't so in the previous times.Just as @chilwell said, it has become a prayer point when making transactions and this things aren't supposed to be so and I think the government rather than making things hard for us, should help lias with Musk to help provide more stable network.

comments.author: Merit.s
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptomultiplier on March 08, 2023, 08:30:43 PM*Could there be any other better explanation to why even online transactions and the recent online apps for swift money transfer and other transactions, OPAY, PALMPAY are experiencing same network issue, although it is not as severe as that affecting bank apps and their USSD codes?*What other apps can enable swift transactions without network delay or scammers/hackers issues?Poor network and poor banking system is the cause,Emefiele needs Nigeria to go into cashless policy without making sure that the banks upgrade their banking system to meet up with the system, neither did he tell the banks to upgrade their network so that transactions will be easy and faster because there must be congestion in the banking network. We should all relax and hope that all this delay in transactions or poor network is sorted out soon,if not we will be left with no choice than to adapt. Fela say una suffering and smiling. I dey suggest say right now we need to dey reason 5G network.

This na the koko but wait oh, all those banks and digital wallets wan tell me say dem no get maintenance team wey dey look how traffic dey to advice for the increase of system capacity. Okay wait you wan tell me say this banks get customers pass Binance or other cryptocurency apps wey dey transact billions daily from millions of users? The truth be say this banks don't value customer review as they have no effect in the Nigerian market, if na outside make dem mumu this thing and dem go see how their stock go just fall and wipe them out of business.How many months now and the banks never upgrade dem servers, you wan tell me say all those maintenance awof dem dey chop wetin dem dey use am do. So dem no get cash to use maintain their network for a clean transaction. Wetin come dey pay me na this digital wallets, they're meant to be digital yet they're following the footsteps of the banks. See kuda wey been dey do everybody well but from no where dey dun Join dem even OPay of all people. Why this digital banks no go get better server. We dey truely surfer for this country, e just be like dem all gather hold meeting for our head to frustrate us.

comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on March 09, 2023, 06:21:53 PMAnd one question wey I dey always ask to be say, na this kind network na im federal government and central bank say make we take enter cashless society???I am realtiredire of Nigeria make I no lie 🤥. Baba the mata tie rapper oooo, because with the way things dey go now, we really need an overhaul upgrade of our traditional banking systems because the level of hustle Nigerians dey goes through now done double e come to be like say when you work to make the money, you go do x2 work to spend the money again this na inside life for 9ja 4all of us ooo. -Now the question where I dey asks myself be said if thing dey hard for is were get knowledge about alternative currencies such as Bitcoin we're we dey use do transaction now if not we're we for end up. -How are those who are unbanked surviving at the moment our every transaction na either through transfer or pos? -The 5G network fit help with this matter?

comments.author: Zanab247
comments.body: Infact, d network failure is adding to the hardship cashless policy is causing in our country. Network will not allow transaction to be successful, and some people will send money to their love ones but they will not receive the money and the sender will be debited which is really causing some fear to people not to accept transfer in their various businesses. If dis bad network continue till next month, I guess there will be a massive damage in people business and it will also affect many POS business too. If bank and opay can lack network in this season, what is the way forward? Hope MTN, GLO and Airtel will not experience the same thing soon.

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: I’ve had bad experiences with USSD code before and promised myself never to use it again. It’s a shame that the banks have not been able to perfect the ussd transfer, most times wire transfers done through this method have problems. For this reason I only use mobile bank apps, the transaction receipt on mobile app always put to rest doubts or disputes. Some banks have a WhatsApp bot where you can make wire transfers, and personally I haven’t had problems with that either.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: How far guys how una Dey, I no understand the levels the country they head to anymore. First them been talk say the cash less issues, na to better the country economy and on the side prevent election corruption.The presidential election is over, no be only just that The Supreme Court has ordered the use of the old note until December 31st but yet the presidency hasn’t said anything yet now coupled with network and transactions problems.

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: Before now, many banks have poor banking infrastructures and the new CBN cashless policy brought about a surge in online transactions as individuals and SMEs are resorting to online transactions like POS and bank transfers. As such there are lot of traffic which is one of the reasons for the poor network, delay and failed transactions. I was debited 5k by UBA last 2weeks when I wanted to make a transfer, I was lucky it got reversed after 5days. I've three digital wallets Opay, Alat and Chippercash, so far I think I'm more satisfied with Opay services as I rarely encounter issues when performing transactions with it.

comments.author: Belarge
comments.body: Due to the way the country be na wey be say money no dey anywhere and the kind charge wey POS people dey collect don make people dey do only online transactions, and the level of online banking transactions wey people dey do now come plenty well well pass before nai come dey make bank network dey worry, (na so me I think o)because every body come dey buy and sale their commodities just with online banking transactions only, so now e don choke...
